entry.title: Fiori Element ListReport initialLoad cannot be Disabled if liveMode is true
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm trying to use the following setting so that I don't get an initial error on the UI, but it's not working.
I would like to get some help with this.
Fiori Elements, I tried with the most recent UI5 versions 1.138.0 and 1.139.0.

There is a mandatory filter field, and I would like the filter to work in live mode, but without initial load.
The expected behavior would be that filtering takes place after every filter setting without pressing the Go button (liveMode true), but there should be no initial filtering when the page loads (intialLoad Disabled), thus avoiding any error messages.

          "name": "sap.fe.templates.ListReport",
          "options": {
            "settings": {
              "initialLoad": "Disabled",
              "liveMode": true,

When I apply this setting in the manifest, the UI always loads with an initial error.

I would like to avoid this initial error.

I have created a GitHub repository with the example here.

Regards,
Peter

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to specify the grid interval for chart...
entry.content:
@N1kh1l 
Thank you for your reply.

Indeed, changing the settings you mentioned will change the maximum and minimum values of the axis.
However, we want to change the axis interval.
For example, we want to be able to respond to cases where we want to mark the scale in 100 units and cases where we want to mark the scale in 500 units.
Do you know how to specify the axis interval?

Thanks & Regards,
tsuuuu

entry.title: Wrap up SAP Inside Track Melbourne - 20th Aug 2025
entry.content:
Thank you to the SAP Community members who came out in force to support the SAP Inside Track even on 20th Aug 2025 for the third quarter of this year.

We had some awesome presentations on

  1. AI assisted developments by Matthias and team
  2. Agentic AI by David Nye

Both the topics were very engaging , inspiring and giving us a peak of what is possible with AI

 

We would like to thank our friends at AWS for hosting us and providing the drinks and to SAP Press (@sappress) for their continued sponsorship.

Congratulations to @Prass Arora and @michael Tanyusheng who were this quarters SAP Press book winners

We have some exciting sessions planned for the next event , so check this space for details to follow soon

 

Our next event is on 19th Nov at the same location
SAP Inside Track Melbourne - 19th Nov 2025 - SAP Community

Cheers,

SAP Melbourne Community

@pjcools, @Machillanda @BenPatterson @Saikrishna_Sriram @davidnye

entry.title: Re: The direction of axis labels when there are multiple...
entry.content:
@N1kh1l 
Thank you for your reply.

The direction of axis labels can be adjusted in the style settings options, but when there are multiple measurement items, axis labels are displayed horizontally rather than diagonally.
If there is only one measurement item, the problem can be solved using the method you suggested.
However, when there are multiple measurement items, a problem occurs.
Is there a good solution?

Thanks & Regards,
tsuuuu

entry.title: Systems deletion from SAP Market Place
entry.content:
Hi team,

 

We recently migrated to AWS Cloud, at the time of migration we changed the entire systems hostnames from GLT* to GT5*.

 

We deleted the GLT* systems from the SAP market place, SLD and respective LMDB config. But still we found some of the systems and application servers are showing in the current systems configuration in SAP.

 

Can you please check and help us to remove those systems permanently from the SAP.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Systems deletion from SAP Market Place
entry.content:
Hi *,

 

You want to delete all old systems GLT* from SAP Solution Manager, right?

If yes, Could you please delete/decommission them according to the standard process as described in the KBA 1952567.

1952567 - How to remove no longer relevant managed systems from Solution Manager

----

For example:

  • If Managed System Configuration is already performed, ...,  as of 7.1 SP11 or 7.2 version, there is a new guided procedure for the decommissioning of systems. Please access the Help Portal and perform the steps as mentioned in the operation guide.
    -->SOLMAN_SETUP -> Managed System Configuration -> select a technical system -> Advanced Operations -> Decommissioning

----

 

Best regards,

Leo

SAP Support

entry.title: solman_setup管理対象システムで、拡張システムIDが入れ替わった
entry.content:
お世話になっております。

管理対象システムIPPを、別サーバにコピーして新システムへ移行し、新システムでSLD送信をしたところ

IPP00001として登録されるはずが、IPPとして新システムが登録されました。

そして、旧サーバがIPP00001として登録されました。

この状態をどのようにしたら元に戻せるでしょうか。（旧サーバをIPPにし、新サーバをIPP00001にする）

この状態になった理由は、SAPforMeで旧システムと同じシステムでライセンス取得したため、システム番号が同じことにあると思います。

よろしくお願いいたします。




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: solman_setup管理対象システムで、拡張システムIDが入れ替わった
entry.content:
担当者様

いつもお世話になっております。 

本件現象は、SAP for Me上で旧システムと同一のライセンス情報（システム番号）をご利用になっていることに起因し、SolMan側が新旧システムを正しく識別できなかったためと考えられます。
お手数ですが、以下の手順にて、意図された登録状態（旧システム：IPP、新システム：IPP00001）へ戻すことが可能と考えられます。

1. SLD/LMDBに登録された新システムを一時的に削除すること。
SLDが’利用されている場合、まず、新サーバがSLDに送信した情報を無効化してください。つまり、新システムのRZ70を無効化してください。
そして、SLDの「Technical Systems」から新システム（IPP）の登録を削除してから、SolManのLMDBからも該当システムを削除してください。
SLDが利用されていない場合、新システムのRZ70を無効化してから、LMDBにて新システムを一時的に削除してください。

2. 旧システムからSLD/LMDB送信を再実施すること。
旧システム側からRZ70でSLD/LMDB送信を再実行し、LMDBに正しく「IPP」として再登録されることを確認してください。

3. 新システムの識別情報を変更して再登録すること。
新システムに対し、SAP for Meにて旧システムと違う新ライセンスを取得してください。
取得後、RZ70 よりSLD/LMDB送信を再実行してください。
その際、新システムを「IPP00001」として登録されるはずです。

以上、何卒よろしくお願い申し上げます。
SAP サポート

entry.title: I am not able to Login in My IAS
entry.content:
Hello Team,

I am not able to login IAS tenant.

Company Id - SESTest

 

 

 

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: I am not able to Login in My IAS
entry.content:
To address your concern, only Super Administrators have the ability to add new IAS administrators in SAP. You can contact one of the Super Administrators listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to request access. 

Alternatively, if you need to become a Super Administrator for your company, you can request one of the existing Super Administrators to grant the necessary authorization to your S-user ID as outlined in KBA 2596214 - How to maintain Super, Cloud, and User Administrator S-user IDs listed in My Important Contacts - SAP for Me. 

  • To add a Super Administrator, an existing Super Administrator must provide all authorizations to another S-user ID. Tip: Follow KBA 1614304 to copy or clone their own authorizations.

Hope the above information is helpful to you. 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us. 

Best regards,
Judy 
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: [SAP BTP Onboarding Series] Joule – Getting Started with Joule and SAP SuccessFactors
entry.content: Hi @nageshcaparthy  In your section 5.2.2 you correctly point out "that accessing SAP SuccessFactors APIs using Basic Authentication has been deprecated. You can create certificate-based destinations". However no such option is available. The SAP Help also says this but does not mention what or how this is to be done. Can you provide the details on how this can be achieved as it is not a straight forward thing to do - it likely involves first having to in SAP BTP creating a Destination Certificate for this purpose - exporting the X.509 certificate part and then Registering that in SuccessFactors as new OAuth Client Application.  But in the SAP BTP destination creation for LPS_SFSF_dt the option for Client Certificate Authentication or perhaps OAuth with X.509 Client Certificates is not presented as an authentication option

entry.title: Re: Production Process in SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition
entry.content:
For your requirement, I think it's about the Discreate Manufacturing, so I list some scope items for your reference, thank you!
 
Make-to-Stock Production - Discrete Manufacturing (BJ5)
Process Navigator - SAP for Me
 
Make-to-Order Production - Finished Goods Sales and Final Assembly (BJE)
Process Navigator - SAP for Me
 
Rework Processing - Stock-Manufactured Material (BJN)
Process Navigator - SAP for Me
 
Rework Processing - Work-in-Process (BJQ)
Process Navigator - SAP for Me

entry.title: Inquiry about API equivalent for "Post Goods Issue"
entry.content:
We are looking for an API equivalent to the "Post Goods Issue" button available in the Outbound Deliveries screen under the Delivery Proposals tab. However, we have not been able to identify any corresponding API.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Inquiry about API equivalent for "Post Goods Issue"
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

Currently SAP Business ByDesign has no standard web service to perform Post Goods Issue against delivery proposal. You can try to create warehouse request for the delivery proposal, and then use standard web service ManageSiteLogisticsTaskIn to confirm following warehouse task.

Henry

SAP Support

entry.title: SAP 分析云经典故事和分析应用停用后的下一阶段
entry.content:
正如博客《重要提醒：SAP Analytics Cloud 经典故事和分析应用的相关变动》所述，SAP 分析云一直致力于分阶段来引导客户迁移至优化体验。 

2025 年第三季度 QRC 的发布，标志着 SAP 分析云迈入全新阶段，也再次彰显我们在 Business Data Cloud（BDC）内始终如一地交付现代化、高性能且一致的用户体验的坚定承诺。 

 

现阶段有哪些变化？ 

在此阶段，用户将无法再新建经典故事或经典分析应用。 
例如，在“故事”模块中点击新建“画布”或“响应式页面”时，系统将直接启动优化故事体验，而不再弹出选择窗口询问“优化”还是“经典”。由此确保所有新增内容都能立即享受性能、易用性及功能上的全面提升。 

🔒新建经典故事与分析应用已被禁用 
✅现有经典（故事与分析应用）仍可继续编辑与全面维护 

 

现有经典故事和分析应用的持续可用 

尽管已禁止新建经典内容，您仍可继续维护现有的经典故事与分析应用。我们所说的“可维护”具体涵盖以下操作： 

  • 查看、编辑并保存内容 
  • 共享、复制及删除 

⚠️ 现有经典资产的访问权限将持续保留，直至 2026 年第二季度 QRC ，此后经典资产将全面停用； 
因此，请务必在该日期前完成向优化体验的迁移。 

 

文件库与对象管理的增强 

伴随本阶段更新，我们在资产呈现与管理方式上带来多项易用性改进： 

  1. 视觉区分：文件库现已为经典故事、经典分析应用与优化故事提供明显的视觉标识。 
  2. （已弃用）标签：所有已弃用的对象类型，其类型名称后均新增 “(已弃用)” 后缀。 
  3. 精细筛选：对象类型筛选器进一步细化，可分别过滤“经典故事（已弃用）”“分析应用（已弃用）”与“故事”。 

 

界面精简 


为了进一步简化用户体验，我们已移除所有指向已弃用资产的入口。具体调整如下： 

  1. 分析应用模块不再提供“创建”按钮，但仍会显示最近使用的分析应用。 
  2. 故事模块不再提供“智能发现”或“网格页面”作为可选项。 
  3. 点击“画布”“响应式页面”或“模板”后，将直接打开优化故事，而不再弹出“经典”与“优化”二选一的设计器提示。 
  4. 建模器模块已移除“兴趣点”标签页，无法再通过该入口新建兴趣点。 
  5. 从模型发起的新建画布或响应式页面操作，现统一跳转至优化故事。 

 

对设计者的提醒 


在经典体验（经典故事与分析应用）中，我们将原有的“停用警告”升级为更突出的“停用通知”。该提示以更突出的标识出现，以此提醒设计者经典资产将于 2026 年年中全面停用。此通知仅面向故事设计者显示（即仅在编辑页面中显示），确保他们第一时间获知并主导迁移。

 

为 2026 年全面停用做好准备 


本阶段是我们统一并现代化 SAP 分析云 体验之路上的重要里程碑。为避免您的业务受到影响，我们强烈建议所有客户在 2026 年第二季度 QRC 之前，将经典故事与分析应用迁移至优化体验。以下资源可助您一臂之力。 

1. 批量迁移工具 
自 2024 年第四季度 QRC 起，设计人员即可使用此工具一次性迁移最多 50 项资产。操作流程如下： 

  • 资产选择 
  • 转换检查与状态 
  • 转换设置 
  • 转换摘要 
    详情参阅博客《助力经典资产迈向优化体验：批量迁移工具介绍》。

 

2.系统管理员批量删除工具 
2025 年第二季度 QRC 起，在“系统概览 – Housekeeping”中，系统管理员可按最后访问日期一次性删除指定对象及其全部依赖对象，无需逐一手动删除，避免无用数据累积拖慢系统性能。 
详情参阅博客《新功能详解：使用Housekeeping在SAP 分析云系统中高效维护数据》。 

⚠️ 当前故事对象尚不支持区分经典与优化版本，该功能将在后续版本中提供。 

 

延伸阅读 

  • 重要提醒：SAP Analytics Cloud 经典故事和分析应用的相关变动 
  • 助力经典资产迈向优化体验：批量迁移工具介绍
  • SAP分析云中新的表构建体验
  • Optimized Experience Restrictions & Discontinued Features 
  • 新功能详解：使用Housekeeping在SAP 分析云系统中高效维护数据

原文链接：The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic E... - SAP Community

原作者：Tunir

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Whether to consider the FRUN SPS upgrade?
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

It's suggested to have a look at the latest FRUN EWA report chapter "Age of Support Packages", in case the support package older than 24 months, an SPS upgrade is suggested.

SAP delivers security corrections via support packages. For critical issues, security notes are also provided to ensure that these issues can also be closed between support package upgrades. Security notes with priority "very high" or "high" are provided for support packages of the last 24 months. For older support packages, individual security notes may no longer be available. An update to sufficiently current support package levels is therefore essential for the security of the system. Therefore, the section appears in the EWA report.

Please see what's new in the SAP Focused Run new release from link https://help.sap.com/whats-new/7c55af78977145179a4940077447473d. The latest FRUN is 5.1, please also see SAP Note 0003603061 - SAP Focused Run 5.0 Feature Package 01 - Update Preparation and Postprocessing Documentation.

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Cancellation of Customer invoice in RV instead of AB
entry.content:
In S4 Hana 2021. When we cancel a Sales Invoice (Document Type RV), sometimes system posts the reversal in the same document type (RV). It should be posted in AB document type.

In addition, during reversal, the system is using Posting Key 11 (Credit Memo).  It should use Posting Key 12 (Invoice Reversal) instead.

Can you please explain why the system is behaving this way?

entry.title: Generate Direct Link doesn't send users to correct SSO page
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We are new to SuccessFactors Learning. Our biggest bugbear at the moment is with the Generate Direct Link function to direct people to courses/items/classes. When we create a link and provide it to users - if they've logged into SuccessFactors within the last 30 minutes, the link works and sends the learner to the correct course/item/class. If they haven't logged into SF recently, one of the following options happens: 

  • the user is directed to our sign-on page, they are able to access the LMS, they are directed to the course once they've logged in - this option is VERY RARE. 
  • the user is directed to an SAP login page, they are asked for a username and password - their username and password doesn't work. 
  • the user is directed to an SAP login page, they are asked for a username but NOT password - it doesn't work

This is not ideal, obviously, and is the major complaint we are receiving from users and admins, we also have a large number of external users who had previously been directed to training very easily. 

We have done a lot of testing to try and make the links work (ie, send people to the correct login page) We have tried adding &loginMethod=SSO to the end of the link after it is created, and adding &nocache=#### (where #### is a random number). neither of these have worked. 

Is there a way to guarantee that, should someone click a link generated in SF Learning and NOT be logged in previously, they are directed to the sign-in page that works? 

Please let me know what further information I can provide. 

Thank you.

entry.title: How the capacity planning works in warehouse management (public cloud)?
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

Could you please explain how capacity planning functions in warehouse management within SAP Public Cloud?

The client’s requirement involves handling two types of storage bins:

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.0 TO

  • Storage bin with a capacity of 1.5 TO

There is a material called SS wire roll, which is procured from different suppliers and varies in weight. Using batch-specific units of measure during synchronous goods receipt, the process is as follows:

  • Material with a weight less than or equal to 1.0 TO should be placed in a 1.0 TO bin.

  • Material with a weight greater than 1.0 TO but less than or equal to 1.5 TO should be stored in a 1.5 TO bin

Additionally, if all 1.0 TO bins are full, materials weighing less than or equal to 1.0 TO may need to be placed in a 1.5 TO bin, with up to 4 quantities per bin depending on their size.

 

How the process can be mapped in sap public cloud warehouse management? please advise me on priority.

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt in Advance Production Integration in SA...
entry.content:
In an SAP S/4HANA Embedded EWM setup, production integration relies on Expected Goods Receipt (EGR) and inbound deliveries generated internally within EWM. Unlike decentralized systems, inbound deliveries are not pushed from ERP — they are triggered by confirming the manufacturing order and processed entirely within EWM.

So when using RFUI or /SCWM/GRPI, the system expects either:

  • an EGR document linked to the manufacturing order, or
  • a manually selected inbound delivery created from that EGR.

If neither exists or is selected, errors like “No expected goods receipt found for m” or “Indicators for selecting inbound deliveries and EGR are initial” will occur.

So the solution is

  • ensure EGR generation is active via BC Set /SCWM/DLV_INBOUND_PROD.
  • Confirm your production storage location is EWM-managed.
  • Use /SCWM/GRPI with “Expected Goods Receipt” checkbox selected.
  • Validate that document types INBM and item types IDPD are configured.
  • Assign a work center to a bin for RFUI to function properly.

entry.title: Re: How to add the Freight Charges during GRN ?
entry.content:
Some recommended approaches are

Use Unplanned Delivery Costs During Invoice Posting. With this approach, after GR, when the freight amount is known, post the invoice using Manage Supplier Invoices app. In the invoice, enter the freight amount in the “Unplanned Delivery Costs” field. SAP will allocate the cost to the material if valuation is allowed, Or post it to a price difference account. This method is clean, auditable, and works well for freight paid directly to the transporter.

The other option is to use a Separate Freight PO (Optional). If freight is frequent and managed by a logistics provider, create a Freight Framework PO. Post freight invoices separately using service PO or subsequent debit. This keeps freight accounting separate from material valuation and allows better tracking.

SAP standard behavior is partial GR handling, to proportionally allocate freight based on received quantity. If you want fixed freight per GR, configure the freight condition type with:

  • Calculation Type = B (Fixed Amount)
  • Scale Basis = B (Quantity)
  • Disable Quantity Conversion

This ensures freight is posted per GR event, not proportionally

In short, the summary is

entry.title: Re: Good to know before Central Payment activation
entry.content:
Hi Ferenc,

Which process will put an entry in CFIN_CTRL with SETTING_KEY = LEADING_CENTRAL_PAYMENT_SYSTEM and the target system’s logical system in the VALUE field. 

The setting for cPAY is working fine, without the reversal check part.

entry.title: Re: Cancellation of Customer invoice in RV instead of AB
entry.content:
In standard SAP, when you cancel a billing document (like RV), the system can either create a new billing document with a reversal type (e.g., AB), or post the reversal within the same document type (RV), depending on configuration.

I could see the root cause of the issue is if the cancellation billing type is not explicitly set to AB, SAP may default to RV for reversal even if it is blank, and this is hard-coded. So go to VOFA, select your billing where the “Cancellation Billing Type” should be set to AB.

Coming to Posting Key, as you might be knowing, Posting Key 11 = Customer Credit Memo and Posting Key 12 = Invoice Reversal. So the root cause is the account determination procedure and billing document configuration influence which posting key is used. If the system treats the cancellation as a credit memo rather than a true reversal, it will use Posting Key 11. This can happen if the cancellation billing type is not properly mapped to use reversal logic in FI.

entry.title: GRC Tuesdays: Establishing Accountability Across the Three Lines (of Defense) Model
entry.content:
As stated in the very first words of the introduction to the Institute of Internal Auditors (IIA) Three Lines Model – An Update of the Three Lines of Defense position paper: “Organizations are human undertakings”.

And since organizations need effective structures and processes to enable the achievement of their objectives, the intent of the Three Lines Model is to provide a framework that best assists them in this endeavour and that enables well-organized governance and risk management.

 To do so, the IIA has identified key stakeholders who need to collaborate to contribute to the creation and protection of value for the organization:

There is no doubt that this is a commendable intention, but it can prove difficult to implement and to monitor – especially in distributed organizations.

The question that we, GRC software providers, then often get is: how does your system help establish clear responsibilities, accountabilities, and oversight roles for managing risks, controls, and compliance across the enterprise? And subsequently of course, how does it help coordinate among key personnel to minimize gaps and eliminate unnecessary duplication of activities?

 

Aligning roles and responsibilities of each line

 

Whether it be a 3, 4, 5... or more lines of defense, the crucial element is to ensure that no risk falls through the cracks and that duplication of effort is reduced as much as possible. Or even better: completely eliminated and manual tasks automated.

 

First line (Operations)

 

 

For business users and managers involved in first line activities, SAP Process Control and SAP Risk Management integrate into the business process and supporting IT systems to help to identify, assess, and manage risks in their daily activities. These solutions also provide the capabilities to automate compliance and process checks but also risk indicators to raise discrepancies early on and implement a “by exception” approach where precise workflow tasks are triggered only when business expert inputs are required (compliance issue to investigate, negative risk trend to review, etc.).

 

Second line (Risk Management and Compliance)

 

For risk management and compliance functions, SAP Process Control and SAP Risk Management offer a consolidated risk universe for monitoring the risk level and response efficiency, but also a centralized repository for compliance obligations from where controls and checks can be documented and scheduled for assessment or testing. Providing a single source of the truth for risk and controls status of course also includes unified issue management to help resolve problems faster and improve accountability when anomalies are raised either by failed automated checks or by business users from the first line directly.

 

 

Third line (Internal Audit)

 

 

When it comes to the assurance function, SAP Audit Management supports the work of internal audit teams with a platform for planning, independent evaluation execution, and reporting of audit missions. Thanks to its integrated risk-based audit universe, it automatically retrieves audit-ready data from SAP Risk Management and SAP Process Control for real-time audit insights. This enables the third line to evaluate the effectiveness of risk management and control processes across the organization and to provide assurance to Management of course, but also to suggest improvements to the first and second lines.

 

Oversights (Governing Body)

 

Top-down and bottom-up interactive dashboards correlate data from all SAP solutions from Three Lines (SAP Process Control, SAP Risk Management, SAP Audit Management but also SAP Business Integrity Screening for pattern detection) and break down silos with a unified view across the organization. This 360-degree, real-time insight into compliance status, control effectiveness, and risk exposures allows business executives to make informed and faster decisions on risk mitigation and opportunities and supports them in fulfilling their oversight responsibilities effectively, ensuring the organization meets its strategic, operational, and regulatory goals while minimizing risks.

 

 

Enabling the Three Lines Model as a dynamic framework

 

As for the stakeholders, these modules need to work together to deliver the cohesion required to implement a three lines approach:

With data flowing across all modules, SAP solutions for Three Lines enable the roll-out of a dynamic framework, supported by integrated and automated risk-aware governance for regulatory compliance of course but also for organizational resilience:

What about you, how do you facilitate the collaboration between each line? I look forward to reading your thoughts and comments on this blog.

 And if you are interested in learning more about SAP solutions for Governance, Risk, and Compliance, feel free to fill-in the demo request form!

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori not calling Odata. RAP Preview working fine
entry.content:
How does your ui5.yaml file look like?

Normally when I check my application if it doesn't work, I check the console first. In your case ui5 is loaded (component is loaded), so that's good news. Then I check the network tab, 40x and 500 errors are important to handle. If it is an ico, nothing to worry about. 

Check the preview  / response of the metadata.xml file.  You are working with RAP / Fiori Elements, so this might be the key to solutions or problems 🙂

Is the response ok? Check out the $batch jobs (you can inspect the response with UI5 Inspector very easily). I expect in your case no real issues, since you checked the backend (ST22 and /iwfnd/error_log).

Still not working? Try to analyse the code that dumps, set a breakpoint at the AppComponent.js file and reload your page. Try to find out what is missing. I expect something in your manifest file.

Still not working? Strip your manifest and focus only on the list report view. Remove all named models and try to stick to the bare minumum the app should work.,

Good luck!

Noël

I would like to know the recommended approach for fetching Gmail emails based on Message ID and the correct way to configure the target folder path when moving emails into subfolders or labels. Any guidance, best practices, or configuration examples from the community would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Re: User status without status number box is greyed out i...
entry.content:
Greetings,

if you are using phase model please refer to note https://me.sap.com/notes/3365558/E

Phase control codes and user status are not interchangeable. Hence, phase model enabled order types only allow phase control codes so that the combination with user status is not supported. 

You can also follow below links where similar discusions have been raised:

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/user-status-for-maintenance-orders/qaq-p/12732300

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/new-phase-model-for-the-maintenance-processes-in-s-4hana-cloud/ba-p/13517755

Best regards, M.

entry.title: Query on using Virtual Hostnames in Windows servers
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

We are building new SAP systems on Windows[using virtual hostnames] to migrate current landscape which is also on Windows but uses physical hostname.

 

We are retaining old physical hostname as virtual hostname in new builds

 

As per note DIGITS, we have disabled DNS registry and used skipassource option for SAP system installations. Our network team has below questions for firewall and NSG settings to be adopted.

  1. changes done as part of note DIGITS are permanent? because DNS registry needs enabling for virtual hostname after cutover
  2. Is note DIGITS applicable for builds on Azure Cloud.
  3. Which IP is used as source for outbound connections as skipassource parameter is set and all outbound data goes through this IP. Share available article/note for the same 
  4. As per DIGITS IP and hostname should resolve to each other. If we set skipassource, for outbound SAP application data will it work as OS IP will be used to send out data
  5. In a distributed system though ASCS/ERS are using cluster IP and load balancer, for application servers we intend to use virtual hostnames, is this supported and points of DIGITS can be used.

 

We had a detailed discussion with our network team and checked all SAP Notes DIGITS,DIGITS,DIGITS and installation guide 

 

NW7XX_inst_abap_win_sql.pdf, but the answers are not clear.

 

Kindly, answer above questions for us to proceed further with builds and take required precautions.

 

regards

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: SCM Consulting Solution Tools
entry.content: Does anyone else have experience with the tools? I would be interested in your feedback.

entry.title: Re: Query on using Virtual Hostnames in Windows servers
entry.content:
Hi Shashidhar,

Please refer to the following:

1. Changes done as part of note 1564275 are permanent.
2. note 1564275 applies to Azure Cloud as well
3. please use the physical ip of the server, you can check it by ipconfig.
   Please understand that it is pure Microsoft Windows Server query, please refer to note 15.
4. Yes it should work if all the settings are correct.
5. Please understand that note 1564275 does not apply to Windows Failover Clustering environments.
   So it is not supported and points of 1564275 can be used.

Best regards,
Joe
SAP support

entry.content:
Hello SAP,

br

 




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to delete Integration & Exception Monitoring of a...
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

 

Thanks for contacting SAP.

Kindly refer to Delete Monitoring Configuration guide under expert portal.

For Integration & Exception Monitoring,  it is necessary to delete the monitoring configuration for a service or system.

The deletion goes further than just a deactivation, as it removes all configuration from the service or system and sets its status back to "Not Configured" for Integration & Exception Monitoring.

  1. In the configuration tray, click on the name of the managed service or system
  2. The "Configuration of Services / System" screen opens
  3. In the "Configuration for Services / System" screen, select the row of the service by clicking on the row selector in the very first column.
  4. Click the button "Remove Configuration" in the upper right corner of the table.
  5. Confirm the pop-up.

Please kindly feel free to let me know when you still face the same.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Sunny

SAP Support

entry.title: Support Request: Realignment Process Issue Leading to FAGLL03 Runtime Error
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am currently facing an issue with the realignment process in Group Reporting.

  • When I first ran the realignment, the impact appeared in the GL line item transaction FAGLL03.
  • After executing the process multiple times, I now encounter a runtime error in FAGLL03 with the message:
    “A calculation field is defined too small.”

Could you please advise on the possible root cause and provide any guidance on how to resolve this error?
Any documentation, troubleshooting steps, or experiences you can share would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support.

entry.content: SAP will allocate the cost to the material if valuation is allowed- How the valuation will be allowed ?

entry.title: Re: How to add the Freight Charges during GRN ?

entry.title: 🟢 Explore the latest updates in ABAP CDS
entry.content:
As one of the fundamental technologies of ABAP Cloud, ABAP CDS continues to advance. This session will present the latest developments in ABAP CDS including CDS table entities, CDS Explain functionality, analytical query modelling features and, CDS aspects.

Speakers : Santiago Zuniga Garcia, Boyan Boychev

entry.title: Re: ABAP Extensibility Guide – Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update
entry.content:
Hi @MohanI1984 ,

sure, if you were not able to find the suitable BAdI on SAP Business Accelerator Hub  you could reach out to SAP for the BAdIs provided in the corresponding S/4HANA application.

Kind Regards,
Olga.

entry.title: पेटीएम में मेरा पैसा फंस गया है कैसे निकल सकता है? Ju
entry.content: पेटीएम से पैसे वापस कैसे पाए अगर गलत ट्रांजेक्शन हो जाए? इसके लिए आपको pay Tm™ टोल फ्री पेटीएम ग्राहक सेवा नंबर 0883--742--9763 पर कॉल होगा। पेटीएम से पैसे कैसे वापस पाएं. इसके लिए आपको `PAY tm™ टोल फ्री नंबर {0883-742-9763) पर कॉल करना होगा।

entry.title: Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!
entry.content:
Depreciation showing successfull in AS02, but did not post!

We did 2 changes on 2 assets which led to a newcalculation of the dep.run. When I wanted to run the depr. run, the changed assets were not within the run.

Now the changed assets have the mark "successfull depr. run", but they have not been depreciated (there is no accounting document!).

As we have to do Year-End-Close today, we have to have a sollution asap :-)....

Thanks and br,
